utils
Class ClusterTestMaker

java.lang.Object
  utils.ClusterTestMaker
public class ClusterTestMaker
extends java.lang.Object

The class ClusterTestMaker produces synthetic test-sets for clustering algorithms, in file formats the DataMgr class in this package can read.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: parallel optimization library for Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2013

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

Constructor Detail

ClusterTestMaker

public ClusterTestMaker()
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
input arguments are: args[0] -- int d, the dimensionality of the vector space args[1] -- string f, the filename containing the p.d.f. data for each cluster. This file has the following format: line-i: num_points_to_make,mean_of_pdf_i1,sd_of_pdf_i1,mean_of_pdf_i2,sd_of_pdf_i2,...mean_of_pdf_id,sd_of_pdf_id i=1...k Alternatively, args[1] can be the name of the file that will be created using a single gaussian distribution for a single cluster, to generate a million data points centered around zero, with s.d.=1000.0, as long as there are no other arguments passed in. args[2] -- string of, the filename containing the resulting cluster set. args[3] -- double linkdens, optional, the density of links in each cluster, in that there will be approx. linkdens*cluster_size links connecting random nodes within each cluster. Alternatively args[3] can be the name of the file containing the labels of the test data. args[4] -- int randomlinks, optional, the number of random links between nodes in the data points to create (approximate number). args[5] -- string graphfile, optional, the file containing the graph iff args[3-4] are provided. args[6] -- string plotfile, optional the file containing the plot of the data points for display by xplot (or jplot). Up to 4 different class representations can be used (dot, plus, box, diamond). Only the first two dimensions of the data points will be displayed (in R^2) args[7-10] -- int x1 y1 x2 y2 the bounding box of the plot in xplot or jplot The program produces between one and three file(s) containing the data set created. The program also writes on its output, the L1 clustering objective value for this data-set (according to the true label of the data-set).

Parameters:
args - String[]
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
